wikipedia_page.main: Kevin David Masters (born 19 May 1961) is an English former professional cricketer. Masters was born at Chatham in Kent and played for Kent County Cricket Club between 1983 and 1984.Masters made his first-class cricket debut for Kent against Hampshire in 1983. He played four first-class matches for Kent, the last of which came against Somerset, and one limited overs match against Worcestershire in 1984.After a gap of 11 years Masters made his Minor Counties Championship debut for Cambridgeshire County Cricket Club against Norfolk. He later represented the Kent Cricket Board in List A cricket.He has played club cricket for Upchurch Cricket Club in the Kent Cricket League and runs a building and construction company, KD Masters.

response: Daniel Masters (born 7 December 1986) is an English cricketer who played in three List A matches for Leicestershire in 2009 and 2010.Daniel Masters at CricketArchiveDaniel Masters at ESPNCricinfo He was born in Chatham, Kent and is the son of Kevin Masters, who played first-class cricket for Kent and the brother of David Masters who played for Kent, Leicestershire and Essex.
